title: Not by chance, not strength or importance
text: A statistically significant correlation means the observed relationship is unlikely to be due to random chance. It doesn’t mean the relationship is strong or important — just that it’s probably real.

hintAnswer: It is unlikely the correlation occurred by chance
title: Probability of chance
text: If the result is significant, what does that say about the likelihood of observing this correlation by chance?
choices: It is very likely the correlation occurred by chance
It is unlikely the correlation occurred by chance
It proves the correlation could not possibly occur by chance
It means chance played no role in the data at all

hintAnswer: It confirms association but not causation
title: Clarify meaning
text: Does significance confirm causation or just association?
choices: It confirms nothing about association or causation
It confirms association but not causation
It proves the variables are unrelated.
